website_summaries.verdict: Asus packed a lot of value -- and discrete graphics -- into the slim ZenBook Flip 14, making it fine choice for more performance and portability in a two-in-one design.
pros: The Asus ZenBook Flip 14 puts discrete graphics in a thin-and-light, two-in-one laptop
The system's other components are better than you'd find in competing models at the same price
cons: Its USB-C port isn't Thunderbolt 3 and can't be used to charge the laptop, the keyboard feel might take some adjustment and there's no storage for the included pen

customer_reviews.title: The asus ux461un is a Great laptop !
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this purchase. It's a pity the review includes both ux461un and ux461ua. I have the ux461un and it's great ! Beautiful screen, touch screen and pen are ultra responsive especially when used for drawing apps like sketchbook. Sound is great with an amazing surround simulation and the speakers being at the bottom are not muffled at all, you might just have to go in the settings to tweak them to the full potential. Fingerprint has not been an issue for me personally, very responsive and accurate. Very fast laptop whatever the task may be. Tried light gaming and Photoshop and they were running smoothly. Very satisfied with it overhaul, tablet mode is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Loiselier

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT product!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT product!! I love this 2-in-1. Light, sleek, super fast. With the purchase of a multi-port adapter, I have full size keyboard, mouse, phone headset and two widescreen monitors attached for when I'm working at home. One quick disconnect of the adapter and I'm off to the office or client meeting. The laptop doesn't skip a beat. The battery lasts a long, long time as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this model!
customer_reviews.text: The first one wouldn't set up without error messages and shutting itself down, and then the display went crazy. The replacement set up okay and worked well for four days and then the screen was dark on boot up. In internal problem. Lots of hours with ASUS techs, who were all great and very helpful, but they suggested I purchase another model. Amazon was great in quickly replacing the first one, and sending a return slip for the second one as I need to look for a different model. A really great laptop when it worked!
customer_reviews.author: DCK

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the laptop came with a key misplaced. The ports are not well aline with the chassis. At this price, very disppointed with Asus for the quality build and with Amazon for the return policies.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Garó

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bough this refurbished but, other than scuffing/scratches on the box it came in, it looks like new. and works great, I'm impressed that it runs Fusion 360 CAD software as well as it does. The battery drains fast on full performance mode, but still easily gets done what I need, at least 4 hours of CAD work. Drawing with the pen isn't perfect, I seems to not be as sensitive as I would like. The only major complaint so far is it appears I'll have to wipe the hard drive and reinstall windows just to get rid of McAfee crap that comes pre-installed, I've tried everything online I can find, but I can't get it to uninstall.
customer_reviews.author: rjkohn

customer_reviews.title: Sleep issue, no thunderbolt, no HDMI 2.0
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and feeling laptop, but BIG issues. It has a serious sleep problem (as many report) with no solution to date. Even a complete windows re-install on a new hard drive had no effect. Nothing wakes it from sleep. Very irritating. Additionally, I regularly find myself wishing it had a thunderbolt port (the usb-c port is not "thunderbolt-equipped") and a HDMI 2.0 port (the HDMI port is HDMI 1.4). Both the Intel and Nvidia GPUs can support 4k at 60Hz, but because the only video-out port is HDMI 1.4, you are limited to 4k at 30hz (which is really bad). FYI
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this computer!
customer_reviews.text: The computer worked well for about 10 months, then it started freezing and crashing. I called Microsoft (it was running windows 10), they identified the ASUS keyboard driver as the problem. But often the stop code was "WHEA_uncorrectable_error". I called ASUS about the problem, they offer repairs that take 2 weeks. Save yourself all the phone calls, fear of losing your data, and general misery and BUY SOMETHING ELSE. Plus customer service was garbage, they flat out denied the existence of any widespread issue when a simple google search will prove the opposite.
customer_reviews.author: Kemp Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Graphics are the weak point, considering the price
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - Light and portable - Awesome hinge - Great battery life CONS: - Not as powerful as I would like for the price - Barely achieves 30fps at 720p, low settings in Overwatch and Fortnite. The lower power hardware leads to great battery life, and the 1440p display makes for a great browsing or programing experience, but definitely falls short in games. The versatility is awesome -- tablet mode is great just like a tablet, and bending the hinge at odd angles can make it more comfortable to use when lounging or sitting in a confined space (like an airplane). But my next laptop will probably be more focused on graphics performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ugh skip this computer get a mac
customer_reviews.text: Awful experience brand new computer and the camera doesn’t work which we found out during the pandemic went through all “fixes” with the company. The only response is to send it in to be “repaired” by them. 1. We need the computer to work from home/ can’t be without a computer 2. It’s brand new shouldn’t need to be repaired and 3. We can’t go to the post office to mail it as I’m 8 mos pregnant and social distancing to the max. Worst customer service. Buy a Mac and save your time and energy
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laptop. Overall great size
customer_reviews.text: Excellent laptop. Overall great size. Great performance. Stylus response very well. Sturdy, thin, slick, very portable laptop. Just what I wanted and needed. Currently handling my virtual environment very well. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Howard V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Laptop!
customer_reviews.text: After researching several other competitors (Lenovo Yoga, Huawei Mate book X Pro, MacBook, etc.), I decided to get the Asus. Glad I did. Excellent computer. Discrete graphics to play games, video edit, etc. Decent battery life for everyday tasks (Web surfing, emails, Netflix, YouTube, etc.). Came with the pen and converts to a tablet, which is an added bonus, but I found it a little too heavy and unwieldy to be used as a tablet on the go (I'll either use my Samsung Galaxy Tab April my iPad mini for this). But overall, this thing is a beast of a workhorse and can handle whatever I throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a thin, light touchscreen laptop that in fact plays games!
customer_reviews.text: It's thin! It's light! It's a workhorse for the office, and a casual gaming laptop with discrete graphics. I don't think there's anything like this at the any price point. Kudos to Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Div Nanjappa

customer_reviews.title: Love the design and colour, love the touch, love the Batery life
customer_reviews.text: Design: The dark Grey is awesome, gives it something different than the light Grey appeproducts. Sound: Is awesome, but when you listen on max they Vibrate and the sound ist clear than anymore. Touchscreen: works phenominal, though writing with the pen is not the best because it doesnt catch the beggining of the line and so half of the first letter is usually missing. Still OneNote is preinstalled which is a great plus because you can take awesome Notes! Good Batery life and fast charging All in all a good investment
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: I love this laptop, but the audiojack makes me knock off a star
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is one of my favorite laptops. Works extremely well, but the audio is very lack luster for the cost. The sound isn't really anything impressive, but most annoying of all is that the combined audiojack frequently does not recognize when I plug in headphones and I have to restart the computer to get it to work. Given that it restarts in about 2 seconds, it's not a huge deal but can be annoying. This is my only complaint, but I do strongly recommend it and love it for school.
customer_reviews.author: MissBNoble

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly 1 year and screen went dead - right 1 month after Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly 1 year and 1 month, screen went blank! Trying to get an estimate for repairs ! On the product side: I love the notebook , its slick and touch screen is great ! Except that it did not last. Dont know yet why
customer_reviews.author: bay

customer_reviews.title: This laptop is SUPER-FASSSSSST !
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a three-year-old Acer that was running slow. This machine, with the SSD and memory, packed to max really hums. So happy i spent a few more bucks for ASUS quality
customer_reviews.author: TomC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but can get hot
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a development computer that can do some light gaming and this is exactly what I was hoping for. Great battery life, the perfect size and weight, and a great keyboard. I do some game development on this and it runs great. During long periods of gaming the laptop does get pretty hot which is definitely a concern. But the great screen, keyboard, cpu, and the dedicated video card, everything runs great. Definitely a great development machine because of it's performance and portability as long as you are realistic with the differences between a laptop and a high end desktop computer.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo

customer_reviews.title: Good Computer
customer_reviews.text: I got this computer 1 month ago today I really like the computer.I wish the battery life was a little longer.it's real fast good picture quality,enough memory,does most anything you need it for.To bad it didn't have thunderbolt 3.Everything works great hope it last for a long time.Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 2 in 1 for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Fired it up and it’s super fast! Downloads are quick and starts up fast! Great for a little gaming too ... plays rise of the tomb raider at medium settings, doom on medium settings, Starcraft 2 on high settings. Synced up my ps4 controller, no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Ferrata

customer_reviews.title: Fast, quite, and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: One of the best computers I have ever owned. Its fast, quite, and light weight. The screen is very nice, clear, crisp images. Great ergonomic design, easy to use and type on.
customer_reviews.author: rawbert

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Notebook - That's really all that needs to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Great Notebook - That's really all that needs to be said. Believe me I am in the computer hardware support business (still to some degree) and this is what I chose for my personal machine. It is what I recommend to clients that can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dean Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 2 in 1 as a replacement for my son's laptop. He's in his second year of college and needed something a bit more reliable. Plus, something that could handle a little bit of gaming when he so chooses. So far, this computer has shown it can handle the job!
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop - It took a while to find a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Laptop - It took a while to find a good replacement for my Samsung Series 9 but this ASUS is great and has a very good 14" display in a very small package. The only issue I have is the awkward requirement to press the function key to use the page up and page down keys. There has to be a way to make page keys work with a single key.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Fadden

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: a year in, the computer constantly crashes and freezes. It's been in repair through a service location but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: USB-C won't support HDMI and Thunderbolt
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop, only reason for 4 star is: USB-C doesn't work! You can't have a single docking station that would consolidate all your connections like keyboard, mouse, AND two external screens which was the real failure. I have bought 3 USB-C based hubs, including one from ASUS, and none worked with monitor. Their answers above says no Thuderbolt, ok so it won't charge but it should at least provide a hub which it doesn't. As for comment about backlighting, mine works. Just hit Fn F4. I'm right handed so power insert on right is not practical. Everything else is great so I won't repeat the good comments.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh M

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy a used one.
customer_reviews.text: It’s really a good computer. I use it a lot for my college. A bad thing was that I bought a used one that it said “as new”, but the original box was very damaged, put together with tape and there was no instruction with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mariann

customer_reviews.title: Very good Notebook. But i would love USB-C charging and Display port or Thunderbolt 3
customer_reviews.text: The good: slim, light, high quality. The bad: i would pay a lot more for 4k brighter screen. The ugly: can’t run external 4 k monitor on 60hz... only 30, because of no display port or no thunderbolt
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Got it for a 10th grader. Well made and has all the bells and whistles. This should last her through college.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: Just got the laptop today everything is working great so far besides the finger scanner
customer_reviews.text: Just got the laptop today everything is working great so far besides the finger scanner. Will update review in the future once I spend more time with it.
customer_reviews.author: sunny

customer_reviews.title: Sound loudness is horrible and that not all.
customer_reviews.text: I paid a lot for this product and so I respect a good quality product. This laptop has poor audio. Is slow to turn on and turn off. The operating system is so ad low at times. It's just an overall bad product. Maybe I just got a bad apple.
customer_reviews.author: diane scheirer

customer_reviews.title: Four stars as the 2-in-1 generally performs as expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: Four stars as the 2-in-1 generally performs as expected. Screen is pleasantly clear and crisp despite only being FHD and not QHD (but it's a 14" screen, so I consider it plenty good). My only downside, and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5, is that there is no convenient way to secure the ZenBook - it doesn't have a Kensington or Noble lock slot and that's sort of big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Todd L Harbold

customer_reviews.title: This laptop has it all
customer_reviews.text: This laptop has it all: build quality, storage, portability, performance, a discrete graphics card and bundled at a very fair price (a similar configuration for the Lenovo 920, the other laptop I was considering, would have cost me around $400 more). If you want a portable 2 in 1 laptop that can also handle casual games and video editing, this is the best option in the market right now. The only two issues I have with it is so far are the design (average) and that the speakers are located at the bottom, so if you're using it in bed or your lap they may get covered.
customer_reviews.author: alfredandrew

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it!
customer_reviews.text: after less than 6 month display problem, amazon and asus dont replace or refound it!
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product very happy
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well. Boot up quickly and etc. Performance amazing for what we are using it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grate product
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Grate product. But it a bit bigger then 370 model, and disadvantage - windows 10 home addition. Did bought win pro edition - installation was fast and without problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nataliya

customer_reviews.title: Hot new fingerprint reader.
customer_reviews.text: Two days in and, while the lid was closed, the fingerprint reader got so hot that it burnt a small hole in itself and burnt the display panel. Otherwise, it seemed to run quite well; unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to play with it much, before the incident.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed. when you pay $$$$$$ this should be included
customer_reviews.text: Info is wrong on Asus website, DOES NOT HAVE WINDOWS HELLO CAMERA Facial recognition feature, only finger print, I am very disappointed. when you pay $$$$$$ this should be included. I do not know why this Laptop is so expensive. when it is missing such feature.
customer_reviews.author: M Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Super slim and great for everything
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop as a requirement for my degree program, as it requires Windows and I was only on Mac before with not enough space to install Windows. I have a laptop similar to this model at work and was satisfied with it, so I went straight here when I was looking for a personal laptop. The battery life is great, and I can run games on it without any issues. I have noticed that the fan runs high sometimes (even when idling), but when I sent it in for repair they didn't find anything wrong with it, so that may just be the way it is. I've already recommended this laptop to several other people!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

product_meta.title: ASUS ZenBook Flip 14 UX461UN-DS74T Notebook (Windows 10 Home, Intel Core i7-8550U, 14" LED-Lit Screen, Storage: 512 GB, RAM: 16 GB) Slate Grey
product_meta.description: Asus Zen Book UX461 is breathtakingly thin and unbelievably light, with the added versatility of a 360 Degree-flappable touch screen and Asus pen support to take you beyond the boundaries of a traditional laptop. UX461 is built to give you the raw power you need for effortless on-the-go performance. *The actual transfer speed of USB 3.0, 3.1 (Gen 1 and 2), and/or Type-C will vary depending on many factors including the processing speed of the host device, file attributes and other factors related to system configuration and your operating environment.
feature_bullets: 14-Inch wide-view Full-HD nano-edge bezel touch display in 13.3” chassis with Stylus pen and Windows 10 Pre-installed
Latest 8th generation Intel Core i7-8550U Quad Core Processor 8M Cache, up to 4.00 GHz
Fast storage and memory featuring NVMe PCIe 512GB SSD with 16GB LPDDR3 2133MHz RAM and NVIDIA GeForce MX150 2GB GDDR5 discrete graphics
Extensive connectivity with HDMI/USB Type C, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, and SD Card Reader
Sleek and lightweight 3.3 lbs., 0.5-inch thickness, aluminum body for comfortable portability
Built-in fingerprint reader with one-touch login via Windows Hello feature. With ZenBook Flip 14 voice-recognition capabilities, you can control Cortana with your voice

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars85 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
